title: 103_hr103
content:
The "Fair and Competitive Election Act" is the short title of the legislation. It includes a limitation on contributions to House of Representatives elections from individuals who are not local residents. The "Fair and Competitive Election Act" limits contributions to House of Representatives elections from non-local residents. Candidates exceeding the limit must refund or pay penalties. The "Fair and Competitive Election Act" imposes penalties on candidates who accept contributions exceeding the limit by 10 percent or more. The penalty includes paying three times the excess contributions and a civil penalty determined by the Commission. Additionally, an individual cannot be considered a resident of more than one congressional district for the purposes of this subsection. SEC. 3. REDUCTION IN LIMITATION AMOUNT FOR NONPARTY MULTICANDIDATE POLITICAL COMMITTEE CONTRIBUTIONS TO CANDIDATES. No nonparty multicandidate political committee may exceed $1,000 in contributions. Technical Amendment: Exceptions provided in subsection (j).

SEC. 4. BAN ON SOFT MONEY. Title III of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to include limitations and reporting requirements for amounts paid for mixed political activities. The text discusses limitations and reporting requirements for payments made by political party committees for mixed political activities. It defines mixed political activities and repeals an exception to the definition of the term "contribution" in the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Transition rule for excess funds of candidates for the House of Representatives. Transition rule for excess funds of candidates for the House of Representatives. A candidate with campaign accounts exceeding the contribution limit must deposit the excess in a separate account. These excess funds can be used for lawful purposes other than the candidate's election campaign. Funds raised from local individual residents after December 31, 1992, are considered excess. Candidates can transfer excess funds back to the campaign account if the majority of funds were raised locally. No funds can be transferred from the separate account to the campaign account after the specified period. Funds can be transferred from a separate account to a candidate's campaign account after the 1994 pre-primary report period. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on the date of enactment.
